thread.title: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4
thread.title_full: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4

title: Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4
text:
Kathy Willens Harvey, Mets ready for Game 3; Dodgers' Utley suspended 
Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw catches for fellow pitcher Brett Anderson during a workout Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, in preparation for Monday's NLDS baseball game against the New York Mets at CitiField in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Gregory Bull Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw reacts after walking New York Mets' Ruben Tejada during the seventh inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Gregory Bull) Kathy Willens Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws on the field before taking a bullpen session on a NLDS workout day, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015, at CitiField in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Willens) Gregory Bull Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 
Los Angeles Dodgers starting pitcher Clayton Kershaw throws against the New York Mets during the first inning in Game 1 of baseball's National League Division Series, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015 in Los Angeles. (AP Photo/Gregory Bull) Posted: Monday, October 12, 2015 5:34 pm Dodgers pick Kershaw to start on 3 days' rest in Game 4 Associated Press | 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Clayton Kershaw is scheduled to start on three days' rest for the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 4 of their playoff series against the New York Mets. 
The reigning NL MVP and three-time Cy Young Award winner was chosen Monday over fellow left-hander Alex Wood. The best-of-five NL Division Series was tied 1-all going into Game 3 on Monday night at Citi Field. Subscription Required An online service is needed to view this article in its entirety. You
